subject: java webstart and Class not found error
msgSnippet: Please forgive my ignorance, but are there any known issues with Running JUnit tests from a jar file deployed through java webstart? If I run java -classpath
messageBody:
Please forgive my ignorance, but are there any known
issues with Running JUnit tests from a jar file
deployed through java webstart?

If I run
java -classpath dist/pso.jar:lib/junit.jar com.ComSuite
then my CLASSPATH is set properly and all tests are run.

But if I execute this code through java web start via
http://www.cruftworks.com/software/showoff/pso-test.jnlp
then the JUnit Swing GUI reports a 'Class not found
"com.ComSuite.class"

The class that gets executed from webstart is actually
com.ComSuite which has the following in main

junit.swingui.TestRunner.run( com.ComSuite.class );

the jnlp file references pso.jar ( which has test and
normal classes ), junit.jar, and commons-net.jar.

It seems that the ClassLoader is getting confused
about the environment. I clicked the '...' next to
Test class name input field and got the following
error message
"No Test Cases found. Check that the configured
'TestCollector' is supported on this platform.

Shoot in the dark, do we need a java webstart aware subclass of
TestCollector? Depending on how much research is
required, perhaps I can contribute this.

Anywhooos thanks for a great test framework and taking
time to answer my question,
Austin

PS you can browse all source code throughsa
http://cvs.sourceforge.net/cgi-bin/viewcvs.cgi/pho
toshowoff/photoshowoff/

java webstart -- http://java.sun.com/products/javawebstart/ basically
allows 1 click deployment of java applications with some sandbox
restrictions.
